wikipedia.title: Donald Byrd
wikipedia.extract: Donaldson Toussaint L'Ouverture Byrd II (December 9, 1932 – February 4, 2013) was an American jazz and rhythm & blues trumpeter and vocalist. A sideman for many other jazz musicians of his generation, Byrd was known as one of the rare bebop jazz musicians who successfully explored funk and soul while remaining a jazz artist.  As a bandleader, Byrd was an influence on the early career of Herbie Hancock.
